column4: hey.. is there a fix for the constant crashing of firefox when entering flash sites?
make sure you haven't got a competing flash plugin, like gnash
no, you shouldn't remove flashplugin-nonfree
check whether you have gnash installed, and if so, remove that. Then restart firefox and see if it is still crashing.
in firefox, open about:plugins as the URL and see if you have enabled any flash plugins other than libflashplayer.so
yeah "FutureSplash Player", so delete?
yes

futuresplash isn't in synaptic nor can it be found in apt-get remove, I did "locate libflash" and maybe it's part of Opera "/usr/lib/opera/plugins/libflashplayer.so" how do I remove this one do you know?
you must have installed it from within firefox, so that's how you remove it, too.
like preferences->addons->plugins?
could be
what's the filename for futuresplash? It should say on the about:plugins page
it says libflashplayer.so
the futuresplash one?
I see what you mean. We've been barking up the wrong tree.
how many sections are there in your about:plugins page? (A section being one that starts with a headline like "Shockwave Flash" and ends with that grey table.
there should be at least one other section with a title of "Default Plugin".
yeah, that is empty
*how many* of these sections do you have?
here is a snap http://img520.imageshack.us/my.php?image=flashnh9.jpg
that doesn't show what I need to see. Can you highlight the entire page and paste it to http://paste.ubuntu.com please
http://paste.ubuntu.com/58741/
if the text is unclear here's the image: http://img380.imageshack.us/my.php?image=flashlf8.jpg
can't see any conflicts, so that's not the problem, sorry.
